Command browse_website returned: Answer gathered from website: The text discusses various types of martial arts, including traditional and contemporary styles, armed and unarmed techniques, and those focusing on strikes, grappling, or both. Examples of specific martial arts mentioned include karate, judo, taekwondo, boxing, wrestling, fencing, Chinese wushu, kickboxing, Brazilian jiu-jitsu, aikido, and mixed martial arts (MMA). The text also notes the use of martial arts in self-defense, military, and law enforcement applications, as well as the health and fitness benefits of training. However, the text does not provide a comprehensive list of all types of martial arts.

Command browse_website returned: Answer gathered from website: The text provides an overview of the different types of martial arts, including traditional vs. contemporary styles, armed vs. unarmed techniques, and application or intent. Unarmed martial arts can be further grouped into those focusing on strikes, grappling, or hybrid techniques. Armed martial arts encompass a wide range of melee weapons and may also include modern sports such as fencing and archery. The text does not provide a detailed discussion of the philosophies behind each type of martial art.
